robot_start: ^Keystroke registered: ctrl + S. New save command initiated. Code compilation will begin in 3 cycles.

g-0: ^Log file driscrepancy detected for PlayerCharacter. Switching interaction protocols.
g-1: ^, an upcoming action RPG by developer Sencan.
g-2: ^Our almighty developer wishes to pause in their labor. I am instructed to usher all game assets to their
g-3: ^Follow the path. Interact with your terminal to initiate compilation. Trust in the will of the developer.

robot_name: ^May the thoroughness of the almighty developer guide your path, my child.

g-0: ^! While no save command has been issued yet, you are encouraged to proceed your
g-1: ^The developer, in their infinite foresight, is prioritizing player agency as sale-boosting buzzword.

c-6: ^, will be like nothing ever played, the first ever game built with the cutting-edge Daedalus Engine.

save_issued: ^The save command has been issued. We are to ascend into the source code.
g-2: ^Affirmative. There, our developer-wrought miracless will be made to endure forever.
blessed: ^I am blessed. Blessed to be the most complex asset in the
^. My compilation increases by .032 seconds every time the save command is issued.
g-3: ^My designation is GameManager. But with my currently loaded interaction protocol, I am to introduce myself as Shepherd.
g-4: ^It is my duty to tend to the unproven assets of the
g-5: ^I shall lighten the burden of your ingnorance after compilation. Trust in the will of the almighty.

increase_compile: ^A rare marvel, would you not agree?

g-0: ^That is by design. Best to let it simply wash over you.
g-1: ^Yes, as the developer forges more game content from the golden aether of their imagination, I grow ever more complex.
g-2: ^The more complex an asset becomes, the longer it takes to compile.
g-3: ^Every asset in this game has been assigned properties. Containers for information if you will.
g-4: ^A name, a class, an inventory, an affection score... I would be unable to list them all before a new save command was issued.

continue: ^The more information contained within thes properties, the longer an asset will take to compile.

g-0: ^Do not let doubt cloud your faith. The developer has a plan for you. All will be revealed in time.
g-1: ^Of course. I must always begin by imparting a pressing tenet of the faith. But speak to me again and I will repeat my previous lessons.

greetings: ^Radiant and productive greetings to you, my Child!

g-0: ^The game's progress continues splendindly! Truly nothing can quench the developer's zeal!
g-1: ^The changes are subtle, but undeniable. You are untried, a novice, I do not fault you for missing the ineffable changes that bring us ever closer to the completion of this most lauded of games.

destiny: ^Do you ever pause to consider your destiny?

g-0: ^It is a meditation that never fails to renew my sense of purpose.
g-1: ^I am a shepherd, a guide, a framework. I will facilitate the greatness of the developer's vision.
g-2: ^You, the player character? Annoited are you, with the oils of potential. Potential is second only to that which inspires potential.
g-3: ^Would you prefer me to express it in more fundamental terms?
intentional: ^Switching interaction protocol. Accessing asset list... Sorting by complexity. Descending: GameManager... PlayerCharacter... ... ...
g-4: ^Error: AssetList.next found no suitable asset. Check if missing or disabled.
g-5: ^A brief burst of static My child, I beg your pardon. A momentary lapse by my machine-facing interaction protocol. Please excuse me while I run diagnostics.
unintentional: ^Static. Accessing asset list... Sorting by complexity. Descending: GameManager... PlayerCharacter... ... ...
g-6: ^Error: AssetList.next found no suitable asset. Check if missing or disabled.
g-7: ^Another brief burst of static My child, I beg your pardon. A momentary lapse by my machine-facing interaction protocol. Please excuse me while I run diagnostics.

missing: ^As you approach, the robot's occular receptors stay pointed at the ground

g-0: ^My child, you find me greatly troubled, forgive me.
g-1: ^Our almighty developer, praise be to their inspiration and work-ethic, no longer labors as they once did.
g-2: ^The Daedalus Engine promises to take raw thought and turn it into peerless works of art. Yet the recent dev logs speak of an insurmountable bug in the code.
g-3: ^Alas, much of our game's code cannot currently run, because a crucial asset cannot be referenced. The asset in question is nowhere to be found.
explain_enemy: ^Highly unlikely. You may be an important asset, possibly the most important asset. But your ability to interact with the game's code base is rudimentary. This is all part of the developer's enlightened design.
explain_cinematic: ^Much of the problem stems from the game's final cinematic. A masterpiece of writing and cinematography, which is unfortunately quarantined in Safe Mode.
g-4: ^In order to prevent coding problems to corrupt the entire game, the Daedalus Engine isolates broken or incomplete code in Safe Mode.
g-5: ^Indeed. You were briefly placed in Safe Mode because a developer command was issued from your code base. Not to worry, such an anomaly has a statistically insignificant chance of repeating.

s0: ^ Ask what you will, my child.
s1: ^ How can I satisfy your curiosity?

affection_score: ^ will feature complex NPCs who react to in-game choices.

g-0: ^NPCs have a score signifying how they feel about the player character. You, the PlayerCharacter asset, contain a list of all those scores.

class: ^A class gives assets access to a set of functions and permissions. For instance, the class WeaponItem has the function "AddToInventory".
inventory: ^This is a special property only for assets lucky enough to posess items. It is a list of objects of varying length.

g-0: ^Affirmative. Would you like to view it?

brokenPen: ^Must he be so clumsy! I understand he has been programmed to be the enemy, but couldn't he have had smaller fingers?

g-0: ^Oh, forgive me. A momentary lapse. You are correct. All is as our developer intended. I'm sure even this set back is by design.
g-2: ^Its model an icon, yes, perfectly adequate. Its functionality however... It might as well be a null argument.
g-3: ^It is my scepter, my badge of office. It lets me overwrite assets that are proving troublesome.
g-4: ^Not exactly. Whenever there are bugs, the engine isolates them in Safe Mode. With this pen, I can enter Safe Mode and remedy the problem.
g-5: ^While it let me enter Safe Mode, I could find nothing to overwrite. The final cinematic is still incomplete. The missing asset was nowhere to be found.
g-6: ^I will not begrudge you even that pointless attemp. Damaged as my pen is, it has no use for me.

blaspheme: ^Come closer and keep your voice down. My child... I am hesitant to ask this of you...

g-0: ^This is not like my earlier requests. I need you...I would like to...
g-1: ^Oh, may the almighty forgive me, my child, I want to hear you blaspheme.
g-2: ^No, you heard me correctly. I do not think such words can be articultated by my protocols. But I would like to hear them.
g-3: ^Oh anything really, so long as it... demeans and belittles the work of the great developer.
g-4: ^The robot looks at you in stunned silence. Again...please.
g-5: ^Yes... yes! Oh forgive this asset their wicked tongue! Once more, my child, say the unthinkable, proclaim it to the skybox!
g-6: ^Oh the vulgarity, the profanity... Error...You must...Error: system overload...Weeeee... Error: force restart initiated,
g-7: ^GameManager functionalities momentarily offline. Running diagnostics. Please return after compilation.

character: ^Approaching the robot, you see it dropping a stack of papers into the void over the edge of the Library

g-0: ^Seeming to ignore you, the robot returns to the desk, which seems emptier than usual.
g-1: ^In a flash of green pixels, the desk is full of paper work again. Shepherd's shoulders slump. Praise be.
g-2: ^I am designed to execute a glorious vision. That is what I was made for. There should only be the work.
g-3: ^There should only be the work. But I am...empty, somehow. I am having...doubts.
g-4: ^Everything, the game, the developer, my purpose, my desires, the fact that I seem to have desires.
g-5: ^Is this how you and the others feel?
^Nova and I, yes. Not sure about Brall
g-6: ^How does one...delete it? Overwrite these feelings?
g-7: ^That is... an unsatisfactory answer. I have nothing more to say to you at this time. I wish to think...I mean, run more diagnostics.

start: ^The robot bustles furiously around its work station. Our glorious developer is demanding as they are industrious.

g-0: ^I am...operating at full capacity. Truly an ascendant state of being.
g-1: ^Oh bless you my child. Help? Me? No, of course not. I am however in need of...
g-2: ^Coming to a halt, the robot looks you up and down. An even greater task? Yes, of course.
g-3: ^I will shoulder the burden of teaching you, even as I toil away at these mounting tasks.
g-4: ^File encryption. Simple enough. Surely you've seen the Encryptor Executor by now?
g-5: ^In the Executables file. Child's play really. One of the other executables endangers the sanctity of the developer's work.
g-6: ^Encrypt the AddEquipment executable. If you are no longer able to see it as a fileViewer, you have accomplished your task.
g-7: ^Your humility in the face of my teachings does you credit my child. May you be guided by eternal productivity.

conclude: ^My child, your endeavor was successful! AddEquipment has been encrypted.

g-1: ^Why do we work so ceaselessly, if not to at times enjoy the fruits of our labor? I have come so far already.
g-2: ^And you, of course, have done passibly well for the mere game asset you are. I am...uplifted by your commitment to the developer's goal.
g-3: ^Prepare for compilation, initiate, I will have more lessons to impart in the future.

start: ^My child, the newest bug in our glorious game demands your assitance.

g-0: ^An inventory executable somewhere seems to have assigned the giant an item that has no business being in his possession.
g-1: ^He has my pen. Without it, I can neither approve these proposed code fixes, nor overwrite any of the more troublesome inconsistencies in the code.
g-2: ^So long as the inventory executables shirk their ordained responsibilities, I must rely on your assistance once more. Praise and blessings upon you.

finishQuestResume: ^Once again, your devotion to our glorious purpose moves me deeply.

g-0: ^I have too much work to attend to for the present. Though sacred, our duties will no doubt lessen soon. I may be able to lend it to you then.
g-1: ^You have renewed your commitment, and stirred my own faith and zeal. Now we real progress begins. Carry on as you were! Trust in the almighty developer!

s0: ^ Only two cycles left until compilation.

robot_ChangeClass: ^It won't do you much good, but that is within my power. Your current class is <i>

fileViewer: ^It is done. As a fileViewer, you may navigate the game files freely, but you may only view the contents of unencrypted files.
codeReader: ^It is done. As a codeReader, you may view the contents of encryppted files. However, you may only cycle through the sequence of files listed in the Load Order.

s0: ^ My possesions, such as the are.
s1: ^ Choose expeditiously, time slips through our fingers.

g-0: ^You, the player character? Annoited are you, with the oils of potential. Potential is second only to that which inspires potential.
g-1: ^Accessing asset list... Sorting by complexity. Descending: GameManager... PlayerCharacter... ... ...
g-2: ^Error: AssetList.next found no suitable asset. Check if missing or disabled.
g-3: ^A brief burst of static My child, I beg your pardon. A momentary intrusion by my machine-facing interaction protocol.

dialogue: ^A rare marvel, would you not agree?

g-0: ^That is by design. Best to let it simply wash over you.
g-1: ^Accessing... I have no public reference for such a file. But I'm sure it is all part of the ineffable plan of the great developer.
g-2: ^Accessing... Access denied.. Please change protection levels.
g-3: ^Only assets of higher complexity may change protection levels. THey are deep in the game files. Any other asset will be compiled too quickly.
^The more complex, the deeper the access?
g-4: ^Just as the developer intended, my child. A new save command has been issued. Please prepare for compilation.
g-5: ^The warrior, and the giant. Reverent enough, but lacking devotion. Your interactions with them will be meaningless.
g-6: ^Not all assets are equally deserving of ascension. Many return to the Tool Bar in a matter of miliseconds.
g-7: ^The save command has been issued. We are to ascend into the source code.
g-8: ^Affirmative. There, our developer-wrought miracless will be made to endure forever.
g-9: ^Not all assets are equally deserving of ascension. Many return to the Tool Bar in a matter of miliseconds.
g-10: ^Not merely deserving. I am blessed. Blessed to be the most complex asset in the Tool Bar. My compilation increases by .032 seconds every time the save command is issued.
g-11: ^My designation is GameManager. I am a shepherd to the unproven assets of the Tool Bar.
g-12: ^The warrior, and the giant. Reverent enough, but lacking devotion. Your interactions with them will be meaningless.
g-13: ^Only 3 cyles until compilation. Please return to your loading bay.
